intro: Leiothylax callewaertii, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of pale pink or white flowers. It is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
